programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: Elton John joins Jonathan from his home to talk about his latest album The Lockdown Sessions. Back in the studio, the host welcomes Rob Brydon and Judi Love, and there is a musical performance by Craig David and MNEK.

programme.title: FYI Extra
programme.desc: Short bulletin rounding up the day's showbusiness stories.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Saving Money at Christmas: The Big Squeeze? Tonight
programme.desc: Furlough is over, the universal credit uplift has been scrapped and food and energy prices are rising, so many will be feeling the pinch this Christmas. Tonight follows families trying to make ends meet, as well as experts offering festive money-saving tips.

programme.title: Wonders of the Coast Path
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher continues to explore the 870-mile Wales Coast Path. This time around, he travels down Cardigan Bay, where he helps monitor the local dolphin population, discovers a 4,000-year-old sunken forest on a beach and takes part in a Celtic Longboat rowing race.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Christmas Is Magic!
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let Kiss keep you up all night with the finest collection of RandB tunes and nocturnal beats.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When De Gaulle Chose War
programme.desc: Charles De Gaulle's refusal to surrender to the German invasion of France in 1940, and his subsequent escape to London and establishment of a French government in exile.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When Roosevelt Chose War
programme.desc: The United States' entry into the Second World War following the attack on Pearl Harbor, focusing on Roosevelt's decision to engage German forces as well as Japanese.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin try to find paranormal activity at Maysville Slave House in Kentucky.

programme.title: Kindred Spirits
programme.desc: Amy Bruni, Adam Berry and Chip Coffey investigate a jail in Florida. Rumours suggest murderous spirits are lurking in this property.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Derek Schlitter seeks justice for a puppy he finds left for dead in a backyard.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The investigation of an illegal cock-fighting ring reveals deliberate cruelty to the birds.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer David Baddiel, former MP and Strictly Come Dancing 2016 star Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll and Celebrity MasterChef 2015 winner Kimberly Wyatt join host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the offbeat panel quiz and finds out how much Shappi Khorsandi, Ross Noble, Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the world of journalism, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster pose ridiculous Hypothetical scenarios to Sue Perkins, Sara Pascoe, Dane Baptiste and Sindhu Vee.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell. This week he and the gang build a Vegas-inspired motor for a flashy client..

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Eivin takes novice hunter Levi on a hunt. Meanwhile, Otto and the crew work to repair the Constructor boat.

programme.title: Naked and Afraid
programme.desc: Two people try to survive for 21 days in the hot and swampy jungles of southern Nicaragua while armed with only a machete and a roll of duct tape.

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Dave Kindig and the team prepare 17 cars for a competition and a 1939 Buick is taken for a spin.

programme.title: Bear Grylls: Born Survivor
programme.desc: Jake Gyllenhaal joins the adventurer in Iceland, where he is forced to face his fear of heights by crossing a ravine, and battles his way through blizzards.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Drag queen Frank Marino asks the duo to create an over-the-top bedroom aquarium, and the guys also build a pirate ship tank in Florida.

programme.title: Barnwood Builders
programme.desc: Mark needs lots of inventory quickly, so he buys three remote farm cabins. It's a fast-paced triple takedown full of plenty of big crashes, suspense and strategy..

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: Mike, Robert, and the rest of the team salvage a cast iron storefront in Vicksburg, Mississippi. Mike and Tay work together to build a custom table for country music duo Thompson Square.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead enter the market for iconic American SUVs with a 1988 Jeep Grand Wagoneer. However, the vehicle has sagging suspension and defective four-wheel drive.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: An officer is assaulted by a man he is trying to take into custody for beating his partner.

programme.title: Goblin Works Mod Shop
programme.desc: The goblins help record-breaking motorbike racer Maria from Northampton transform a white, blank canvas VW Transporter Van.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: Customs agents get a tip-off about suspicious merchandise coming in from the Middle East. Plus, a sword and animal claws are found in a bag at Madrid Airport.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: At Madrid Airport, a bag with an alarmingly strange smell is searched by a member of the Civil Guard. Plus, a family's car raises suspicions at the Tarifa border.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Cruise ship the Norwegian Epic, and how a state-of-the-art navigation system keeps the enormous vessel on course.

programme.title: Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Day four from Llandudno.

programme.title: Man v Food: Best Of
programme.desc: Adam samples a half-pound filet of fresh hogfish topped with sauteed mushrooms and melted cheese. Plus, Adam is given an hour to eat 180 raw oysters.

programme.title: Man v Food: Best Of
programme.desc: Adam is in Tennessee to taste succulent baby back ribs that have been charcoal smoked for 14 hours. And, he is challenged to finish a humongous smoked meat sandwich.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert Irvine heads to Louisiana to help a restaurant struggling to stay afloat after consecutive years of losing more than $100,000. Can Robert reverse the trend?.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: The chef shares his ultimate guide to baking. His recipes include olive, tomato and rosemary focaccia, leek and pancetta quiche and baked cheesecake.

programme.title: Boom Bust
programme.desc: Erin Ade breaks through the mainstream headlines to find the stories that matter, and help you navigate the Booms and the Busts.

programme.desc: Latest news update. For more information go to www.rt.com.

programme.title: News. Views. Hughes
programme.desc: Special daily afternoon broadcast hosted by journalist and political commentator Scottie Nell Hughes, with a focus on editorial objectivity and interviews & analysis from across the political spectrum.

programme.title: SophieCo
programme.desc: Tune in for the interview show SophieCo with its charming host Sophie Shevardnadze and enjoy good talk. Solid facts, uncommon opinions, thoughtful observations.

programme.title: Dennis Miller Plus One
programme.desc: World-famous actor, comedian and commentator Dennis Miller interviews a range of celebrated guests, from athletes and artists to entertainers and authors.

programme.title: Keiser Report
programme.desc: A no-holds-barred look at the shocking scandals behind the global financial headlines. With the help of Keiser's co-host, Stacy Herbert, and guests from around the world, 'Keiser Report' tells you what is really going on in the global economy.

programme.title: RT Documentaries

programme.title: Headline News
programme.desc: Latest news update. For more information go to www.rt.com.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When Eve finds evidence implicating her boyfriend, aid-worker Stefan, in murder, Boyd promises to support her and help get to the bottom of the mystery. But when it turns out her lover may also be involved in people smuggling, the pathologist becomes determined to prove his innocence, bringing her into conflict with her boss. Joseph Mawle guest stars, with Tara FitzGerald and Trevor Eve.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave comes to blows with his estranged brother over rock memorabilia, and Barry discovers a valuable piece of modern art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A mystery bidder begins to dominate the competition, pushing Dave to the limit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry discovers a mysterious locker with a strange hole in its wall, while Jarrod uses an old trick to put in a sneaky bid.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi learn that big cash comes in small packages, an indecisive Darrell finds himself in a bidder's quandary and Mark Balelo is back with all his usual bravado.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: The New England crews head to the Outer Banks, and face dangerous waters and fierce competition from the local fishermen.

programme.title: Salvage Kings
programme.desc: A lifelong collector's sprawling property proves to be a challenge for the salvage team as its members race to undercover enough valuable treasures to make their long road-trip worthwhile. Ron is also under pressure as he tries to get a vintage truck working.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny Koker and the Count's Kustoms crew revisit some of the most outrageous rides ever featured on the show.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The crew rediscover some of their favourite paint jobs in Counting Cars history, including a 92 Ford ambulance they converted into a spooky ghost-hunting machine.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Take a look back at some of the finest classic cars to grace the Counting Cars garage, like a museum-worthy 1914 Model T pie wagon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers cast their eyes over a car-load of signed Star Trek memorabilia and an antique cannon from 1980s TV series Magnum, PI.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The buyers are impressed by a script for The Godfather signed by Al Pacino, and consider buying a coin-operated children's ride from the 1950s.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How technology such as mobile phones, CCTV and cashpoints can help solve murder investigations.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a loving wife and mother was found murdered at home in Edmond, Oklahoma. Security camera footage weas called upon to help detectives hunt down her killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 62-year-old Narleen Campton, who was found murdered in her home, apparently having been tortured, during Thanksgiving 2011 in Newport, Washington. Though Jeremy Bryant confessed to his involvement, doubt remains over whether he acted alone.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI are called in when a bank manager is unable to open the vault, revealing a sophisticated burglary with losses of $8million.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: A dead puppy is found chained up in an abandoned house, and a cat hoarder is encouraged to give up some pets.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Ross performs life-altering surgery on a puppy, Dr Lavigne examines a prickly pet. Dr Blue and Dr Ross also examine a litter of sick piglets.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Rachel plans to celebrate her sizeable assets with a strapless wedding dress. The design proves too bold for Al and Jo, who try to persuade her to try a more subtle look.

programme.title: The Real Prime Suspect
programme.desc: Former DCI Jackie Malton looks into the case of British au-pair Louise Woodward, after a child she was looking after had been rushed to a hospital unresponsive.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: Terror strikes as severed body parts start showing up across the English countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A brunette is killed and left inside a burned out car and police attempt to track the perpetrators down.
